page.title: 17Employment:Fauldhouse Area
page.content: {Mining }was the main work in this area.{ Iron and Clay} were mined but mainly coal. Until twenty five years ago , most men were employed in coal mines. When mines closed two factories employed the men . One in Bathgate manufacturing cars and trucks called the{British Motor Company }and one in Shotts making large deisel engines called Cummins. The{B.M.C.}has closed and 25_30 percent are unemployed. All{quarrying for sandstone }has finished in the area but there is still one quarry working extracting sand. There is still one clay mine in operation.It is open cast.{Women}have to travelto Whitburn or Edinburgh and are employed in{clothing}and biscuit making {factories.}A few work locally in shops and schools. { }
